Today in 1973, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police gifted The Queen a horse to mark the force’s 100th Anniversary. The horse, named Jerry, was renamed “Centenial” to mark the occasion. Her Majesty is the RCMP’s Commissioner-in-Chief. 🇨🇦

#cdnpoli #cdncrown #cdnhist https://t.co/vnQNieAL4w

Happy Simcoe Day! 🇨🇦

John Graves Simcoe, the King’s representative in Upper Canada (Ontario) constructed Yonge Street from York (now Toronto) to Lake Simcoe. The Queen’s Rangers began cutting the 48km road in 1793, completing it in 1796.

#cdncrown #cdnhist #onpoli #topoli #to https://t.co/mDHhK023tY

Today in 1922, King George V (The Queen’s grandfather) appointed Julian Byng as Canada’s 12th Governor-General, the King’s representative in Canada. Lt-Gen Byng or “Byng of Vimy” commanded the Canadian Corps at the successful capture of Vimy Ridge in 1917. 🍁

#cdnpoli #cdnhist https://t.co/u9OCAbEkEK

Today in 1973, The Queen accepts ‘Jerry,’ one of the five finest horses in the Royal Canadian Mounted Police Stables; a great-grandson of the famous racehorse Man O’ War. Jerry would be renamed Centenial; in honour of the RCMP’s 100th Anniversary that year. #cdnpoli #cdncrown https://t.co/bnwDdNPoQv

Today in 1973, The Queen accepted Jerry, one of the 5 finest horses in the Royal Canadian Mounted Police Stables. Jerry was renamed Centenial; to mark the RCMP’s centennial. Jerry replaced Burmese, the Queen’s aging black horse at her annual birthday parade. 🐴
#cdnpoli #cdnhist https://t.co/Y8Sgwu4d68

Happy Simcoe Day! 🇨🇦

Lt. Governor John Graves Simcoe was the King’s representative in Upper Canada (Ontario). In 1793, he initiated the end of slavery, making Upper Canada the first British colony to abolish the slave trade. 

#cdnpoli #to #topoli #onpoli #cdncrown #cdnhist https://t.co/H2OP5TbeOF

Following her installation in 2021 as The Queen’s representative in Canada, Governor General Mary Simon visited the National War Memorial & laid flowers on the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, as the Canadian Armed Forces’ new Commander-in-Chief. 🇨🇦

#cdnpoli #cdncrown https://t.co/ECv1ZzM7va

The office of the Governor General of Canada 🇨🇦 is the 2nd oldest continuous institution in Canada, following the monarch. Dating back to Samuel de Champlain, who served as Governor of New France in 1627, Canada has had French, British & now Canadians fill the role. 

#cdnpoli https://t.co/g5hkZr05aQ

Today is Emancipation Day in Canada. 🇨🇦 In 1793, the King’s representative Lt. Governor John Graves Simcoe approved the Act Against Slavery ending the slave trade & making Upper Canada (Ontario) “the first British Colony to abolish slavery.”

#cdnpoli #cdnhist #cdncrown #onpoli https://t.co/Miu6pJoPE9

“I cannot lead you into battle, I do not give you laws or administer justice but I can do something else, I can give you my heart and my devotion.” - Elizabeth II, Queen of Canada, 1957. 🍁

#cdncrown #cdnhist #cdnpoli https://t.co/8D6IFwcAt9

Her Majesty The Queen of Canada sits on the Throne of Canada at the Opening of Parliament in 1957. 🇨🇦

#cdnpoli #cdncrown #cdnhist https://t.co/Sfl8HP4Qcb

The ‘Nova Scotia Giantess’ & world record holder for tallest girl at almost 8 foot, Anna Swan was born in 1846. Her fame took her places & led to an unusual friendship with Queen Victoria. The Queen even gifted Anna a wedding gown when she learned she was to wed. 👰‍♀️ #cdnhist https://t.co/yJnQE0V0rI

Did you know that Canada was the first country to put Queen Elizabeth II on its money? She first appeared on notes back in 1935 as the 9-year old Princess Elizabeth. 🇨🇦

#cdnpoli #cdncrown #cdnhist https://t.co/1Q9qDSLfHo

On page one “in the name of The Queen” of Canada, all Canadian passports request that Canadians are permitted to travel freely, without hinderance & be granted any local assistance if necessary. 🇨🇦

#KnowCanada #cdnpoli #cdncrown https://t.co/meqFvnHhmy

“I have always viewed Canada 🇨🇦 as a metaphor for family…As members of our large & diverse Canadian family, we have to replace the hurt with hope & find the grace & humility to stand together & move towards a more just & equitable future.”- Governor General Mary Simon #cdnpoli https://t.co/zApz5rZrcf

101 years before Prince Harry brought the 2017 “Wounded Warriors” Invictus Games to Toronto — in 1916 Queen Mary hosted a party at Buckingham Palace for wounded UK & Canadian soldiers. 🍁

#cdncrown #cdnhist #cdnpoli #uk #WWI https://t.co/3lYtD3UJWk

Today in 1978, The Queen chatted with war veterans in Deer Lake, Newfoundland, ahead of flying to Edmonton, Alberta to open the 1978 Commonwealth Games. #cdnpoli #cdnhist #nfld #cdncrown https://t.co/DO8lAigkGn

Today in 1964, Sudbury, Ontario’s ‘Big Nickel’ was unveiled highlighting local wealth derived from nickel production. The 1951 replica Canadian nickel features the head of King George VI, Canada’s King in 1951 (the current Queen’s father). #cdncrown #cdnpoli #onpoli #cdnhist https://t.co/FAmfoqtSKA

“I want to offer my heartfelt gratitude to Her Majesty The Queen for placing her trust & confidence in me…& her abiding love for this magnificent country…To the Canadian Armed Forces, I am honoured to become Commander-in-Chief of Canada.” - Governor General Mary Simon #cdnpoli https://t.co/fujEEFkt1p

Today in 1936, King Edward VIII (the current Queen’s Uncle) unveiled the Canadian National Memorial at Vimy Ridge in France. He said, “An inspired expression in stone, chiselled by a skilful Canadian hand, of Canada’s salute to her fallen sons.” 🇨🇦 #cdnpoli #cdnhist #cdncrown https://t.co/Qgq63HhnUB

Today in 2021, at her installation Governor General Mary Simon took her seat on the Throne of Canada. 🇨🇦 Canada’s throne chairs are reserved for The Queen or Governor General (& their spouse) & are made of wood gifted by The Queen from her Great Windsor Park. #cdnpoli #cdncrown https://t.co/gYezUtJh3k

Today in 2021, Mary Simon officially became Canada’s 1st Indigenous Governor General, The Queen’s representative in Canada. Her Excellency the Right Honourable Mary Simon is Canada’s 30th Governor General & Commander-in-Chief of the Canadian Armed Forces. 🇨🇦 #cdnpoli #cdncrown https://t.co/9Ci7i4TsfT

Yesterday The Queen’s representative & Canada’s 1st Indigenous Governor General, Mary Simon, joined the Pope for his historic apology for the Catholic Church’s cooperation with the Canadian Government’s “catastrophic” policy of Indigenous residential schools. 

#cdnpoli #cdnhist https://t.co/upBOCxpQcT

Prince Edward Island is named after Queen Victoria’s father, Prince Edward who lived in Nova Scotia in the 1790s. He is the current Queen’s great-great-great grandfather. #cdncrown #cdnhist #PEI #nspoli #cdnpoli https://t.co/l5N88bCjns

The Victoria Cross instituted by Queen Victoria in January 1856, is the highest award in the Canadian honour system and is only awarded for bravery, a daring act of valour or self-sacrifice, or extreme devotion to duty in the presence of the enemy. 🍁 #cdncrown #cdnpoli #cdnhist https://t.co/YE1ZKJBni8

Queen Victoria came to the throne in 1837, amid uprisings in eastern Canada & she reigned until 1901 - longer than any Canadian monarch until our current Queen. During this time, First Nations treaties were signed, the RCMP formed & 7 of 10 provinces united.🇨🇦 #cdnhist #cdnpoli https://t.co/LCcDKbVhyR

Elizabeth II is Canada’s Queen & Head of State. The Prime Minister is the Head of Government & swears his Oath to her. The Queen lends her executive authority temporarily to the elected government of the day, to exercise it in her name. 🇨🇦 #cdnpoli #cdncrown https://t.co/9SlTQqKHSn

Canada 🇨🇦 has over 1,500 royal place names across the country. While virtually every town has a King & Queen Street - some notable places include Prince Edward Island; Alberta (Princess Louise Caroline Alberta); Regina, SK (Latin for queen); Victoria, BC & many others. #cdnpoli https://t.co/AoxIaRC89A

The Manitoba Government has stated that the ‘Mother of Confederation’ statue of Queen Victoria that was vandalized, toppled & beheaded by protesters last year outside the Manitoba legislature is beyond repair & will not be restored. The statue dates back to 1904. #cdnpoli #mbpoli https://t.co/6HrXy8Sq94

Today in 2021, Her Majesty The Queen virtually met with Ms. Mary Simon who had just appointed to become the Governor General of Canada & act on her behalf in Canada. During the audience Her Majesty invested her as an extraordinary Companion of the Order of Canada. #cdnpoli https://t.co/zjmOxn28aC

Happy 9th Birthday, Prince George! 🎉

The eldest child of Prince William & Kate, Prince George is third-in-line to the throne of Canada. 🇨🇦

(📸: Duke & Duchess of Cambridge)
#cdnpoli #cdncrown https://t.co/W86H1mXeg2

The Queen laughs as Jean Chrétien swears “merde” under his breath, during the 1982 Parliament Hill signing of the Constitution Act. Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau broke the tip of the fountain pen before handing the inkless pen  to Chrétien. 🇨🇦

#cdnpoli #cdnhist https://t.co/ebLMOcZoMg

A temporary home for Canada’s Queen Elizabeth II Monument. The statue of Her Majesty on her RCMP horse Centenial, stands in a park between the homes of Canada’s Prime Minister & Governor-General. The statue will return to Parliament Hill after renovations. #cdnpoli #cdncrown https://t.co/cUlYYru2ra

To mark The Queen’s Platinum Jubilee, Her Majesty’s 70th year on the throne of Canada, Lt. Governor Perry has opened a provincial garden 🌷 in Charlottetown, PEI, that intertwines purple salvia & white Diamond Jubilee tulips, with Mi’kmaq symbols & symbolic tobacco. #cdnpoli #PEI https://t.co/uL1CFDaIW9

Congratulations to the Royal Canadian Geographical Society on the launch of their #PlatinumJubilee educational website. 🇨🇦🎉

@RCGS_SGRC #cdnpoli #cdnhist https://t.co/vnDPInTEIg

Did you know that until the 1960s the Tent Room in the Governor General of Canada’s official residence, Rideau Hall, was used as an indoor tennis court by day & a banquet hall at night? The Governor General is The Queen’s representative in Canada. #cdnpoli #cdncrown #cdnhist https://t.co/oBie3u9Cgq

Today in 2017, The Queen & Prince Philip arrived to cheers from the crowd outside Canada House, London. Greeted by the Governor General & the Royal Canadian Mounted Police to mark Canada150. #cdnpoli #cdncrown #cdnhist https://t.co/vW8UwPnLTx

Today in 2017, The Queen smiled as she was presented with the Sapphire Jubilee Snowflake Brooch, made from arctic sapphires. A gift from the people of Canada to mark her 65th year as Queen of Canada. #cdnpoli #cdncrown #cdnhist https://t.co/OFqFMeTDli

Did you know that The Queen’s 1953 Coronation Dress embroidery included green maple leaves with gold stitches to represent that she is The Queen of Canada? 🍁

Happy 75th Birthday to Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall! 🎂🎉

#cdnpoli https://t.co/Mj7kjnE9YC

The effigy of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II first appeared on Canadian coins in 1953 when she was 27 years old. Three effigies: 1965, 1990 & 2003 followed - each inscribed, ELIZABETH II DEI GRATIA REGINA, meaning “Elizabeth II, by the grace of God, The Queen.” 🇨🇦 #cdnpoli https://t.co/WtRH7Csy9L

The Canadian National Exhibition’s Queen Elizabeth II Coronation Crown Arch in 1953, constructed to celebrate the crowning of Princess Elizabeth as Canada’s Queen earlier that summer. 🇨🇦

Today in 1994, Mason Jim Spooner restored a head to a figure at the Canadian National Exhibition’s Princes’ Gates in Toronto. The Princes’ Gates were named after The Queen’s uncles, Prince Edward (later King Edward VIII) & Prince George in 1927. 

#cdnpoli #cdnhist #topoli https://t.co/d8frMFbNqK

The Sovereign’s Medal for Volunteers was created in 2015. The medal is awarded by The Queen  of Canada to volunteers who have made a significant and continual contribution to their community, either in Canada or abroad. 🇨🇦

#cdncrown #cdnpoli #cdnhist https://t.co/5f9W8fQZYZ

Queen Victoria chose Bytown as Canada’s capital 🇨🇦, being on the Ontario & Québec border it did not favour English or French Canada. She then renamed it ‘Ottawa’ for the river & local First Nation. In this decision she acknowledged Canada’s 3 founding peoples. #cdnhist #cdnpoli https://t.co/m8q7WMRyYJ

In 2012 Canada celebrated The Queen of Canada’s 60th year as Queen. To mark the occasion, Governor General Johnston, the Rt. Hon. Jean Chrétien & government unveiled the Queen Elizabeth Scholars program to help young Canadians study across the Commonwealth. #cdnpoli @QEScholars https://t.co/egds50wLRB

Royal Assent is the The Queen or Queen’s representative’s (Governor General or Lt. Governors) approval of a bill that has passed both houses of the Canadian Parliament or a provincial legislature. It is the final required step before a bill becomes a law. 📜 🇨🇦

#cdnpoli https://t.co/8ObfA6RY2w

This state portrait of Queen Victoria, painted in 1842, was relocated to the Senate of Canada Building last year. Rescued from fire 4 times, during the 1916 inferno that destroyed Parliament it was hurriedly cut out of its frame, rolled up & saved. 🍁

#cdnhist #SenCA #cdnpoli https://t.co/wQxjWkNjpX

Canada’s founders, led by Sir John A. Macdonald, originally wished to call their new nation the “Kingdom of Canada,” but London opposed, fearing it would antagonize the American Republic. In turn they settled on the “Dominion of Canada.” 🍁

#cdnhist #cdnpoli #cdncrown https://t.co/xlTfb1IY64
